intro: Stenocline gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's stenocline, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy foliage. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
